title: Science Quiz
description: Explore the fascinating world of science with questions about physics, chemistry, biology, and more.

questions.question: What is the chemical symbol for water?
questions.explanation: Water's chemical formula is H2O, meaning it contains two hydrogen atoms and one oxygen atom.

questions.question: What is the powerhouse of the cell?
questions.explanation: Mitochondria are known as the powerhouse of the cell because they produce ATP (energy) through cellular respiration.

questions.question: What is the acceleration due to gravity on Earth?
questions.explanation: The standard acceleration due to gravity on Earth is approximately 9.8 m/s².

questions.question: Which blood type is known as the universal donor?
questions.explanation: Type O negative blood is considered the universal donor because it can be given to people of any blood type.

questions.question: What is the process by which plants make their own food?
questions.explanation: Photosynthesis is the process by which plants convert sunlight, carbon dioxide, and water into glucose and oxygen.

questions.question: What is the smallest unit of matter?
questions.explanation: An atom is the smallest unit of matter that retains the properties of an element.

questions.question: Which planet is closest to the Sun?
questions.explanation: Mercury is the closest planet to the Sun in our solar system.

questions.question: What is the pH of pure water?
questions.explanation: Pure water has a pH of 7, which is considered neutral on the pH scale.

questions.question: Which gas do plants absorb from the atmosphere?
questions.explanation: Plants absorb carbon dioxide from the atmosphere during photosynthesis to produce glucose.

questions.question: What is the hardest natural substance on Earth?
questions.explanation: Diamond is the hardest natural substance known on Earth, with a Mohs hardness of 10.

questions.question: Which organ produces insulin?
questions.explanation: The pancreas produces insulin, a hormone that regulates blood sugar levels.

questions.question: What is the speed of sound in air at room temperature?
questions.explanation: The speed of sound in air at room temperature (20°C) is approximately 343 meters per second.

questions.question: Which element has the highest melting point?
questions.explanation: Tungsten has the highest melting point of all elements at 3,422°C (6,192°F).

questions.question: What is the largest organ in the human body?
questions.explanation: The skin is the largest organ in the human body, covering the entire external surface.

questions.question: Which force keeps planets in orbit around the Sun?
questions.explanation: Gravitational force keeps planets in orbit around the Sun, as described by Newton's law of universal gravitation.
